intent_atoms.description: Implement tolerant parsing traversal guard logic in StreamingBoxWalker to enforce forward progress, depth limits, and corruption budgets while maintaining strict-mode behavior.
Guard implementation emits documented ParseIssue codes (guard.no_progress, guard.zero_size_loop, etc.) with correct metadata when thresholds trigger.
Lenient traversal never loops indefinitely on corrupt fixtures; strict mode continues to abort on the first structural error.
New corrupt fixtures (e.g., zero-size flood, overlapping boxes) are added and referenced by regression tests covering guard activation paths.
CLI/app surfaces reflect guard issues in summaries or telemetry hooks without duplicate reporting.
Guard-triggered nodes adjust ParseTreeNode.status to .partial and integrate with existing logging/telemetry categories.
Extend ParsePipeline.Options with guard configuration parameters and propagate them through tolerant parsing entry points.
Update StreamingBoxWalker (and related iterators) to enforce minimum cursor advances, zero-length limits, recursion depth caps, cursor regression fences, and per-frame issue budgets.

functional_units.name: ParsePipeline Options Guard Configuration
functional_units.description: Extends the parsing pipeline options to include guard configuration parameters for tolerant parsing.

functional_units.name: StreamingBoxWalker Forward Progress Enforcement
functional_units.description: Ensures that the streaming box walker advances its cursor forward and does not regress, enforcing minimum cursor advancement.

functional_units.name: Zero-Size Loop Detection
functional_units.description: Detects and prevents loops caused by zero-length boxes during traversal.

functional_units.name: Recursion Depth Cap
functional_units.description: Limits the depth of recursive parsing to prevent stack overflows or infinite recursion.

functional_units.name: Cursor Regression Fence
functional_units.description: Prevents the parser cursor from moving backwards, acting as a fence against regression.

functional_units.name: Per-Frame Issue Budgeting
functional_units.description: Implements a budget for the number of parse issues per frame to limit corruption handling.

functional_units.name: ParseIssue Emission
functional_units.description: Generates documented ParseIssue codes such as guard.no_progress, guard.zero_size_loop etc., with correct metadata when thresholds are triggered.

functional_units.name: Partial Node Status Update
functional_units.description: Adjusts ParseTreeNode.status to partial for nodes affected by guard triggers.

functional_units.name: Logging and Telemetry Integration
functional_units.description: Integrates guard-triggered node status changes and issues with existing logging/telemetry categories.

functional_units.name: CLI/APP Summary Reporting
functional_units.description: Displays guard issues in summaries or telemetry hooks within the CLI/app without duplicate reporting.

functional_units.name: Regression Test Fixtures for Guard Paths
functional_units.description: Adds or refreshes test fixtures (zero‑size flood, etc..) and tests that cover guard activation paths.
